questions.text: What is Capacitor?
options: A CSS framework for mobile applications
A native runtime that allows running web apps as native apps
questions.explanation: Capacitor is a modern native runtime that allows running web applications natively on iOS, Android, and the Web.

questions.text: What is the command to sync your web app with native projects?
questions.explanation: The command "npx cap sync" copies your web build to native projects and updates Capacitor plugins.

questions.text: What WebView does Capacitor use on iOS?
questions.explanation: On iOS, Capacitor uses WKWebView, which is Apple's modern and high-performance WebView.

questions.text: What is the main Capacitor configuration file?
questions.explanation: The capacitor.config.ts (or .json) file contains all your Capacitor project configuration.

questions.text: What does the command "npx cap open android" do?
options: Runs the app in an Android emulator
Opens the project in Android Studio
Publishes the app to Play Store
questions.explanation: The command "npx cap open" opens the native project in the corresponding IDE (Android Studio for Android, Xcode for iOS).

questions.text: What directory contains your web app in the Android project?
questions.explanation: Your compiled web app is copied to android/app/src/main/assets/www/ when you run cap sync or cap copy.

questions.text: What do you need to configure to use Live Reload on a device?
options: Configure server.url with your local IP in capacitor.config.ts
Install a special hot reload plugin
Connect the device via USB only
questions.explanation: For Live Reload, you must configure server.url with your local IP so the device can connect to your development server.

questions.text: What is the difference between "npx cap copy" and "npx cap sync"?
options: copy only copies web files, sync also updates native plugins
copy updates plugins, sync only copies files
questions.explanation: "copy" only copies your web build to native projects. "sync" runs copy and also updates Capacitor native plugins.

questions.text: What web frameworks is Capacitor compatible with?
options: Any framework that generates static files
questions.explanation: Capacitor is framework agnostic. It works with React, Vue, Angular, Svelte, or any web project that generates static files.

questions.text: What is the "Bridge" in Capacitor's architecture?
options: The communication system between JavaScript and native code
questions.explanation: The Bridge is the communication system that allows your JavaScript code to call native APIs and receive responses from native code.

questions.text: What plugin is used to handle the app lifecycle?
questions.explanation: The @capacitor/app plugin provides methods to handle the application lifecycle, like detecting when it goes to background.

questions.text: What is the correct method to listen when the app goes to background?
questions.explanation: You use App.addListener("appStateChange", callback) to listen to app state changes, including when it goes to background.

questions.text: What plugin is used for secure storage of small data?
questions.explanation: @capacitor/preferences is the official plugin for storing key-value data persistently and securely.

questions.text: What does PushNotifications.requestPermissions() return?
questions.explanation: requestPermissions() returns a PermissionStatus object with the "receive" property indicating if permissions were granted.

questions.text: What is the function of SplashScreen in Capacitor?
options: Show a loading screen while the app initializes
questions.explanation: The SplashScreen shows a startup image while your web application loads, improving user experience.

questions.text: What Keyboard plugin method hides the virtual keyboard?
questions.explanation: Keyboard.hide() programmatically hides the virtual keyboard when no longer needed.

questions.text: What Keyboard plugin event fires BEFORE the keyboard appears?
questions.explanation: The keyboardWillShow event fires before the keyboard animation, allowing you to adjust the layout in advance.

questions.text: What is the advantage of using the Browser plugin over window.open()?
options: Allows customizing the toolbar and keeps the user in the app
questions.explanation: The Browser plugin opens URLs in an in-app browser with customizable toolbar, keeping the user inside your application.

questions.text: What NativeBiometric method verifies user identity?
questions.explanation: verifyIdentity() requests biometric authentication from the user showing the system prompt.

questions.text: Where does NativeBiometric store credentials securely?
questions.explanation: NativeBiometric uses iOS Keychain and Android Keystore, which are hardware-level encrypted storage.

questions.text: What Capacitor method tells you if the app is running on a native device?
questions.explanation: Capacitor.isNativePlatform() returns true if the app is running on iOS or Android, and false if on web.

questions.text: What is the correct webDir directory for a Vite project?
questions.explanation: Vite generates the production build in the "dist" directory by default.

questions.text: What App plugin event is used to handle deep links?
questions.explanation: The appUrlOpen event fires when the app is opened via a custom URL scheme or deep link.

questions.text: What CameraResultType returns a URL usable directly in an tag?
questions.explanation: CameraResultType.Uri returns a webPath that can be used directly as an image src.

questions.text: What app format does Google Play require for new publications?
questions.explanation: Google Play requires Android App Bundle (AAB) for new apps, as it allows optimizing download size.

questions.text: What command generates a keystore to sign Android apps?
questions.explanation: The keytool -genkey command (part of JDK) generates a keystore with keys to sign your app.

questions.text: Why is it important to NEVER lose your release keystore?
options: You'll have to reinstall Android Studio
You won't be able to update your app on Google Play
questions.explanation: Without the original keystore, you can't sign updates with the same signature, preventing you from updating the published app.

questions.text: What tool automates the build and deploy process for iOS?
questions.explanation: Fastlane automates common tasks like builds, signing, screenshots, and upload to App Store/TestFlight.

questions.text: What Xcode option is used to create the file for App Store?
questions.explanation: Product > Archive compiles the app in release mode and creates an archive that can be uploaded to App Store Connect.

questions.text: In what file is release signing configured for Android?
questions.explanation: The signingConfigs configuration for release is defined in the app module's build.gradle file.

questions.text: What type of test verifies complete user flows from start to finish?
questions.explanation: E2E (End-to-End) Tests simulate real user interactions through the entire application.

questions.text: How do you test components that use Capacitor plugins in unit tests?
questions.explanation: You create mocks of Capacitor plugins that simulate responses, allowing fast and isolated tests.

questions.text: How much does a Google Play Developer account cost?
questions.explanation: Google Play Developer requires a one-time payment of $25 USD to publish apps.

questions.text: How much does an Apple Developer account cost?
questions.explanation: Apple Developer Program requires an annual subscription of $99 USD.

questions.text: What are "Nutrition Labels" in App Store Connect?
options: Declaration of what data your app collects
questions.explanation: "Nutrition Labels" (App Privacy) are mandatory declarations about what data your app collects and how it uses it.

questions.text: What is a common reason for rejection in both stores?
questions.explanation: Both stores require a publicly accessible privacy policy, especially if you collect user data.

questions.text: What is KYC in the context of fintech apps?
questions.explanation: KYC (Know Your Customer) is the identity verification process required by financial regulations.

questions.text: What regulation applies if your app handles credit card data?
questions.explanation: PCI-DSS is the security standard for handling payment card data.

questions.text: Why should session timeout be implemented in fintech apps?
options: For security, to protect the account if the device is left unattended
questions.explanation: Session timeout protects the user's account if they leave the device unattended or lose it.

questions.text: What is certificate pinning and why is it important in financial apps?
options: Fixing the expected SSL certificate to prevent MITM attacks
questions.explanation: Certificate pinning verifies that the server is the expected one, preventing man-in-the-middle attacks where someone intercepts traffic.
